properties.Name: Mwabvi Fault 2
properties.FaultNotes: Down-thrown to the NW. Within Lower Karoo calcareous shales.

properties.Name: Mwabvi Fault 1
properties.FaultNotes: Downthrow to the NE,  small topographgic expression,  calcaerous shales downthrown against grits.

properties.Name: Panga
properties.FaultNotes: SE section of this fault still active.  Juxtaposes Karoo sediments and lavas in the footwall against Cretaceous sediments and recent alluvium. I ntruded and subsequently deforms dyke, active pre and post Karoo.

properties.Name: Mwabvi Fault 4
properties.FaultNotes: Downthrow to the NW,  Karoo basalts downthrown against Upper Karoo sandstones.  No extension within alluvium,  inactive.

properties.Name: Mwabvi Fault 3
properties.FaultNotes: Downthrown to the NW.  Upper Karoo basalts downthrown against Upper Karoo sandstones and red marls.

properties.Name: Telegraph-1
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes grit in HW against Lower Sandstones in footwall.  Downthrow to the SW.  Intruded by dyke which has been subsequently deformed.  Cut by other faults.  Forms graben with Panga Fault

properties.Name: Telegraph-2
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes grit in HW against Lower Sandstones in footwall.  Downthrow to the SW.  Intruded by dyke which has been subsequently deformed.  Cut by other faults.  Forms graben with Panga Fault.

properties.Name: Nkombedzi-1
properties.FaultNotes: Downthrows coal shales in footwall against lower sandstones and grits in hanging-wall.  Forms small (60 m) escarpment.

properties.Name: Nkombedzi-2
properties.FaultNotes: Downthrows coal shales in footwall against lower sandstones and grits in hanging-wall. Forms small (60 m) escarpment.

properties.Name: Pwadze
properties.FaultNotes: Downthrow to the NW,  Lower Sandstones in HW against coal shales in FW.

properties.Name: Chitsumba
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes Lower Karro grits and calcareous shales against Cretaceous calcaerous sandstones.

properties.Name: Mbuzi
properties.FaultNotes: Downthrow of Lower Karoo sandstone to the SE,  with Lower Karoo grits in the footwall at its NW tip,  beyond which it disappears under alluvium.

properties.Name: Tapasa
properties.FaultNotes: Downthrows massive gritps against coal shales to the E.  Forms small escarpment due to resistant sandstones.  Cut by younger Nyantanda fault.

properties.Name: Nyatanda
properties.FaultNotes: Sandstones downthrown to the SE against massive grits and coal shales.  Associated with a dolerite intrustion.

properties.Name: Maniamba NW
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds one half of the Maniamba graben,  juxtaposes Precambrain Basement against Karoo sediments.  Youngest sediments in hanging wall are Lower Jurassic (?).  Reactivated as dextral shear in the Cretaceous.
properties.Reference: Verniers et al (1989); Key et al (2007); Melezhik et al (2007)

properties.Name: Maniamba SW Western branch
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds one half of the Maniamba graben,  juxtaposes Precambrain Basement against Karoo sediments.  Youngest sediments in hanging wall are Lower Jurassic (?).  Reactivated as dextral shear in the Cretaceous.
properties.Reference: Verniers et al (1989); Key et al (2007);  Melezhik et al (2007)

properties.Name: Maniamba SW (Eastern branch)
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds one half of the Maniamba graben,  juxtaposes Precambrain Basement against Karoo sediments.  Youngest sediments in hanging wall are Lower Jurassic (?).  Reactivated as dextral shear in the Cretaceous.
properties.Reference: Verniers et al (1989); Key et al (2007);  Melezhik et al (2007)

properties.Name: Rio Lumba Fault
properties.FaultNotes: Fault juxatposes basement in its footwall against Karoo sediments in its hanging wall.  Rio Lumba river has subseuqently eroded through into Lake Malawi (?).

properties.Name: Namschweia
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds southeastern of Mchucuhma sub-basin from the Ngaka sub-basin.  Reported to have >1000 m of throw.  Part of a series of east dipping domino-style fault blocks

properties.Name: Ngaka
properties.FaultNotes: Ruhuhu trough fault,  bounds the Ngaka southeast sub-basin.

properties.Name: Idusi
properties.FaultNotes: Unable to trace towards Ketewake as continuous basement between them.  Bounds the Ruhuhu trough to the north.

properties.Name: Ketewaka
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds the Ruhuhu trough to the north.

properties.Name: Ruhuhu North
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds the Ruhuhu trough to the north.

properties.Name: Mahanje
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds the Ruhuhu trough to the north.

properties.Name: North Rukuru-1
properties.FaultNotes: Prominent 600 m high escarpment that contains strike ridge (see Google Earth). J uxtaposes Permo-Triassic (Karoo) sediments against basement in footwall.  Karoo bounding fault? Fault segmented.

properties.Name: Chimaliro
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds Permo-Triassic sediments in its hanging wall.

properties.Name: Henga Valley Fault
properties.FaultNotes: Karoo fault-bounding graben that forms the Henga Valley,  follows pre-existing dextral shear zone.  Possibly some late Cenozoic activity,  but no Quaternary sedimentation in hanging-wall (Kemp 1975)

properties.Name: South Rukuru Fault
properties.FaultNotes: Opposing (subisidairy?) fault to Henga Valley Fault.  Related to Karoo rift that followed pre-existing ductile shear zone.  Possibly some late Cenozoic activity,  but no Quaternary sedimentation in hanging-wall (Kemp 1975)

properties.Name: Nanchidwa
properties.FaultNotes: Fault cuts across Upper Jurassic/Lower Cretaceous Mlanje Massif (Chilwa Alkaline Province) where offsets some streams and intrusion contact.

properties.Name: North Rukuru-2
properties.FaultNotes: Prominent 600 m high escarpment that contains strike ridge (see Google Earth).  Juxtaposes Permo-Triassic (Karoo) sediments against basement in footwall.  Karoo bounding fault? Fault segmented.

properties.Name: Chikhangombe
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds Permo-Triassic sediments in its hanging-wall.

properties.Name: Henga Valley Fault
properties.FaultNotes: Karoo fault-bounding graben that forms the Henga Valley,  follows pre-existing dextral shear zone.  Possibly some late Cenozoic activity,  but no Quaternary sedimentation in hanging-wall (Kemp 1975)

properties.Name: Henga Valley Fault
properties.FaultNotes: Karoo fault-bounding graben that forms the Henga Valley,  follows pre-existing dextral shear zone.  Possibly some late Cenozoic activity,  but no Quaternary sedimentation in hanging-wall (Kemp 1975)

properties.Name: Muzondera
properties.FaultNotes: Fault contains Karoo sediments in its hanging wall.

properties.Name: Nkombe
properties.FaultNotes: Mesozoic Solvsbergite dykes intruded along fault.
properties.Reference: Bloomfield and Garson (1965); Kolawole et al (2021)

properties.Name: Kweneza
properties.FaultNotes: Responsible for 200 m high scarp with down throw to the SE.  Soft muscovite schists on either side of scarp,

properties.Name: Liviranje
properties.FaultNotes: Crops out 10 km to east too.  Termed the Liviranje-Lisungwe Fault by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  Cuts of southern end of Masinjere amphibolite.,  with oblique-slip offset of metadolerite bands.

properties.Name: Liviranje
properties.FaultNotes: Crops out 10 km to west too.  Termed the Liviranje-Lisungwe Fault by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  Cuts of southern end of Masinjere amphibolite.,  with oblique-slip offset of metadolerite bands.

properties.Name: Rivi Rivi
properties.FaultNotes: Lineament mapped from aeromagnetic data.  No surface expression and not included on geological maps.

properties.Name: Kapeni
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from offset dykes and lineaments in aeromagnetic data.

properties.Name: Linengwe
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from offset magnetic lineaments.  No surface expression and not included on geological maps.

properties.Name: Makawa
properties.FaultNotes: Fault marked in geological map (King and Dawson 1976) and lineament in aeromagnetic survey.  On geological maps,  west dip direction of fault inconsistent with topography.

properties.Name: Nkhotakota Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: Cross cuts dominant foliation.

properties.Name: Nkhotakota Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: Minor escarpment,  but no recent sedimentation and fluvial incision into footwall.

properties.Name: Nkhotakota Fault-3
properties.FaultNotes: Minor escarpment,  but no recent sedimentation and fluvial incision into footwall.

properties.Name: Kepembe
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds Cretaceous sediments in hanging-wall.

properties.Name: Dwali
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from erosional feature that Dwali River follows.  Parallel to rift trend but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Mfundazi
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from erosional feature that Mfundazai River follows.  Parallel to rift trend but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Mbamba
properties.FaultNotes: Identified as border fault by Flannery and Rosendahl 1990 and Lao Davila et al 2015,  however,  more recent evidence shows no sediment thickening towards it,  suggesting topography is pre-existing (McCartney and Scholz 2016,  Accardo et al 2018)
properties.Reference: McCartney and Scholz 2016, Accardo et al 2018

properties.Name: Micheleo
properties.FaultNotes: Offsets pre-existing topography laterally.  If normal, would intersect Makankira fault at shallow depth.

properties.Name: Namizumi
properties.FaultNotes: Forms small escarpment along-strike of Makanjira,  but no accumulation of recent sediments.

properties.Name: Litisa
properties.FaultNotes: Forms prominent topography in basement,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Dwambazi
properties.FaultNotes: Major escarpment,  but basement rock mapped in hanging wall.  Hence not intepreted to have been active during East African Rifting.  No evidence that continues offshore.

properties.Name: Dzone
properties.FaultNotes: Southern extent of Dzone Fault as mapped by Bloomfield and Garson 1965,  but analysis of Tan-DEM-X suggests this section not currently active.

properties.Name: Jumbe
properties.FaultNotes: Noted as rift fault by Bloomfield and Garson (1965), but with disected scarp.  TanDEM-X also indicates no recent activity and so considered to be inactive.

properties.Name: Nkweza
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped as 'Rift Valley fracture' by Bloomfield and Garson (1965), but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Chinseme
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped as 'Rift Valley fracture' by Bloomfield and Garson (1965),  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Cross Fault 1
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of E-W striking erosional gullies that are mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965) as strike-slip faults or joints.  The latter are not included here.  No offset observed in aeromag.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Cross Fault 2
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of E-W striking erosional gullies that are mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965) as strike-slip faults or joints.  The latter are not included here.   No offset observed in aeromag.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Cross Fault 3
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of E-W striking erosional gullies that are mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965) as strike-slip faults or joints.  The latter are not included here.  No offset observed in aeromag.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  No evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: Fault offset by Kirk Range Cross Fault-1? One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  No evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: Fault offset by Kirk Range Cross Fault-1? One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  No evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-3
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  No evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-4
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  No evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-5
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  No evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-6
properties.FaultNotes: NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) intepret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  No evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.  Mapped as dipping to west, so unlikely to be tiggered by Lisungwe fault.
properties.Reference: Bloomfield and Garson (1965); Kolawole et al 2021

properties.Name: Kirk Range Cross Fault 4
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of E-W striking erosional gullies that are mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965) as strike-slip faults or joints.  The latter are not included here.  No offset observed in aeromag.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-7
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully, though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-8
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully,  though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-9
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully,  though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-9
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully,  though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-10
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully, though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-11
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully, though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-12
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully,  though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-13
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully, though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Range Fault-14
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of NNE-SSW striking faults that Bloomfield and Garson (1965) interpret to define the rift south of the Liviranje-Fault.  Forms erosional gully, though no evidence from TanDEM-X that currently active

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-3
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-6
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-5
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-7
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-4
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-9
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-10
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-11
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Kirk Foothills Fault-8
properties.FaultNotes: One of a number of N-S striking faults mapped by Bloomfield and Garson (1965).  No obvious topographic expression or evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Wamkurumadzi Tip-3
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped extent of Wamkurumadzi Fault by Bloomfield and Garson (1965),  but considered to represent inactive trace.

properties.Name: Wamkurumadzi Tip-2
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped extent of Wamkurumadzi Fault by Bloomfield and Garson (1965),  but considered to represent inactive trace.

properties.Name: Manguo Hill
properties.FaultNotes: Follows Rift Valley trend but no evidence of recent activity. Offset by ENE fracture?

properties.Name: Manguo Hill
properties.FaultNotes: Follows Rift Valley trend but no evidence of recent activity. Offset by ENE fracture?

properties.Name: Manando
properties.FaultNotes: Fault might be Mesozoic in age and related to other ENE striking dextral faults in region.  Possibly controls hot springs.

properties.Name: Tambani Fault 3
properties.FaultNotes: Associated with step in topograghy,  but no evidence is currently active.

properties.Name: Tambani Fault 6
properties.FaultNotes: Associated with erosinal gully,  but no obvious evidence is active.

properties.Name: Ntembwe
properties.FaultNotes: 500-1000 m of dextral offset of Precambrian Mlindi Ring Structure.  Lower Cretaceous Solvsbergit dykes injected along it.  Sinistral juxtaposation of Lower and Upper Shire Basins (Dulanya 2017)?

properties.Name: Tambani Fault 2
properties.FaultNotes: Associated with step in topograghy and erosional gullies,  but no evidence is currently active.

properties.Name: Tambani Fault 4
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Nteka
properties.FaultNotes: Parallel to and closely associated with the Wamkurumadzi Fault,  but no evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Chimbwinda
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from erosional gully that intersects with tip of Wamkurumadzi Fault.

properties.Name: Majete Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: Fault has no obvious geomorphic expression.

properties.Name: Majete Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: Fault has no obvious geomorphic expression.

properties.Name: Majete Fault-3
properties.FaultNotes: Fault has no obvious geomorphic expression.

properties.Name: Chizunga
properties.FaultNotes: Forms escarpment in footwall of Thyolo Fault,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Mapalera
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Dzunga
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully that is followed by Dzunga River.  No evidence that is currently active.

properties.Name: Nkujidzi
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully with large ~100 topographic expression at northern end,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Nsuwadzi
properties.FaultNotes: Forms incised escarpment in footwall of Thyolo Fault.

properties.Name: Chinyendeni
properties.FaultNotes: Forms incised escarpment in footwall of Thyolo Fault.

properties.Name: Mikolongwe
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully,  but no evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Domasi
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully,  but no evidence that currently active.

properties.Name: Ncheu Step Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of faults that are mapped from erosional gullies that run through syenite intrusions in the Ncheu Step. Unclear if represents joints instead of faults.

properties.Name: Ncheu Step Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of faults that are mapped from erosional gullies that run through syenite intrusions in the Ncheu Step.  Unclear if represents joints instead of faults.

properties.Name: Ncheu Step Fault-4
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of faults that are mapped from erosional gullies that run through syenite intrusions in the Ncheu Step.  Unclear if represents joints instead of faults.

properties.Name: Ncheu Step Fault-3
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of faults that are mapped from erosional gullies that run through syenite intrusions in the Ncheu Step.  Unclear if represents joints instead of faults.

properties.Name: Chiripa Plateau Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of faults that are mapped from erosional gullies that run through syenite intrusions in the Ncheu Step.  Unclear if represents joints instead of faults.

properties.Name: Chiripa Plateau Fault 2
properties.FaultNotes: Fault bounds calc silicate and forms minor escaprment,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Chiripa Plateau Fault-3
properties.FaultNotes: Forms prominent topographic expression,  but this may also represent juxtaposition of different geologic units

properties.Name: Mangochi Hills Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully in footwall of Makanjira Fault.

properties.Name: Mangochi Hills Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully in footwall of Makanjira Fault.

properties.Name: Nankunda-1
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes garnet-bioite gneisses in hanging-wall against charnockite gneisses in footwall.  Mylonites and breccias found within vicinity of fault
properties.Reference: Dawson and Kirkpatrick (1968); King and Dawson (1976)

properties.Name: Nankunda-2
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes garnet-bioite gneisses in hanging-wall against charnockite gneisses in footwall.  Mylonites and breccias found within vicinity of fault.
properties.Reference: Dawson and Kirkpatrick (1968); King and Dawson (1976)

properties.Name: Nankunda-3
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes garnet-bioite gneisses in hanging-wall against charnockite gneisses in footwall.  Mylonites and breccias found within vicinity of fault.
properties.Reference: Dawson and Kirkpatrick (1968); King and Dawson (1976)

properties.Name: Cape Maclear Complex Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes garnet-bioite gneisses in hanging-wall against charnockite gneisses in footwall.  Mylonites and breccias found within vicinity of fault.

properties.Name: Cape Maclear Complex Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: Set of faults that cut across the Cape Maclear intrusion.

properties.Name: Lisangadzi
properties.FaultNotes: Fault noted to downthrow the Nabamba Ridge to the SW,  but otherwise little topographic expression.

properties.Name: Malenga
properties.FaultNotes: Seperates Malenga and Mikalongo hills, but little evidence or recent activity.

properties.Name: Mangochi Hills Fault-3
properties.FaultNotes: Laterally offsets charnockitic block by ~1 km and forms erosional gully.

properties.Name: Mangochi Hills Fault-4
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped along small erosional gully.

properties.Name: Mangochi Hills Fault-5
properties.FaultNotes: Offsets quartzofeldspathic granulites by ~500 m.

properties.Name: Ngombe
properties.FaultNotes: Offsets quartzofeldspathic granulite by ~0.8 km,  and forms small erosional gully.

properties.Name: Nkanga Hill Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from erosional gully.

properties.Name: Linthipe River
properties.FaultNotes: Rare ENE-WSW striking fault for region.  Offsets granulite ridge by ~300 m.

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set 8
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Chirua
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set-9
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Bilila-Mtakataka Fault
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set 6
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set 4
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set 5
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set 3
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set 2
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set 1
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set 7
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Chapita
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of WNW-ESE striking faults in region that cross cut NE-SW foliation.  Mapped by Walters (1972) from aerial photos.  Controls drainage patters,  but often no discernable offset.  May represent regional joint set?

properties.Name: Ntuntama-2
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped as normal fault dipping to east,  but no obvious topopgrahic expression.

properties.Name: Ntuntama
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped as normal fault dipping to east,  but no obvious topopgrahic expression.

properties.Name: Ntuntama-1
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped as normal fault dipping to east,  but no obvious topopgrahic expression.

properties.Name: Madzidzi
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped as normal fault dipping to east,  but no obvious topopgrahic expression.

properties.Name: Nkanga Hill Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: Rare ENE-WSW striking fault for region.  Offsets granulite ridge by <100 m

properties.Name: Ntambalala Fault Network-2
properties.FaultNotes: Complex network of faults (and joints) dissecting topography.

properties.Name: Ntambalala Fault Network-1
properties.FaultNotes: Complex network of faults (and joints) dissecting topography.

properties.Name: Ntambalala Fault Network-5
properties.FaultNotes: Complex network of faults (and joints) dissecting topography.

properties.Name: Kongwe Hill
properties.FaultNotes: Complex network of faults (and joints) dissecting topography.

properties.Name: Ntambalala Fault Network-3
properties.FaultNotes: Complex network of faults (and joints) dissecting topography

properties.Name: Ntambalala Fault Network-4
properties.FaultNotes: Complex network of faults (and joints) dissecting topography.

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set-11
properties.FaultNotes: Complex network of faults (and joints) dissecting topography.

properties.Name: Salima Fault Set-10
properties.FaultNotes: Unlike other fault in this set,  offset along this fault is recorded; ~300 m offset of geological contact.  Fault mapped from erosional gully.

properties.Name: Bua Fault-1
properties.FaultNotes: Unlike other fault in this set,  offset along this fault is recorded; ~300 m offset of geological contact.  Fault mapped from erosional gully.

properties.Name: Bua Fault-2
properties.FaultNotes: Forms erosional gully that cross cuts regional foliation.  Offsets course of Bua River?

properties.Name: Lifumbidzi
properties.FaultNotes: Forms minor escaprment,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Chikora HIll
properties.FaultNotes: Forms minor escparment with fault dipping to the east,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Mtazi
properties.FaultNotes: Normal fault downthrown to the east.  Fault mapped from course of Mtazi River,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Mlowe
properties.FaultNotes: Normal fault downthrown to the east.  Fault mapped from course of Mtazi River,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Mtanga Tanga
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped as normal fault with downthrow to the north,  but no obvious topographic expression to support this.  Fault breccia also mapped.

properties.Name: South Viphya
properties.FaultNotes: Fault bounds charnockites,  but no obvious topographic expression.

properties.Name: Kavuzi
properties.FaultNotes: May link up with Thete fault.  No obvious topographic expression apart from north where follows Kasitu River.

properties.Name: Kavuzi-Splay
properties.FaultNotes: Splay of Kavuzi Fault that follows Lweya River.  No evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Thete
properties.FaultNotes: Normal fault with downthrow to the west.  Mapped from course of Thete River.  May extend to the north along the South Viphya Fault,  but not clear if this is also a normal fault

properties.Name: Mwanza-Namalambo
properties.FaultNotes: Major feature in gravity data.  Connects active Mwanza and inactive Namalambo, unknown if  this section is currently active.

properties.Name: Mwabvi West
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtposes basement gneiss against Karoo sediments.  Abundant qtz and calcite veins and breccias, hydrothermal activity? Forms steep escarpment and connects with Mwanza Fault,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Viplya Mountains
properties.FaultNotes: Interpreted as western border fault to Mwabvi basin.  Mapped as Faults K and L in Chisenga et al (2019) from gravity data.  No geomorphic expression.

properties.Name: Lweya
properties.FaultNotes: Forms minor escarpment.

properties.Name: Kuta Bay
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from deeply incised valley.

properties.Name: Nkhate
properties.FaultNotes: E-W strike,  unlikely to be active in current stress state

properties.Name: Chizunga
properties.FaultNotes: E-W strike,  unlikely to be active in current stress state.

properties.Name: Mwamphanzi
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  E-W strike, unlikely to be active in current stress state.

properties.Name: Limbe
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  E-W strike,, unlikely to be active in current stress state.

properties.Name: Jonathan
properties.FaultNotes: Possibly forms erosinal gully exploited by confluence of the Lisungwe and Shire rivers.  Some prominent topography at southwestern end,  but this is not consistent along strike.  Not associated with any recent activity.

properties.Name: Soche
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Associated with small topographic expression with no evidence of recent activity

properties.Name: Likhubula
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Associated with small topographic expression with no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Namadutzi
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Possible splay of Wamkurumazi?

properties.Name: Feremu
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Forms small valley,  but no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Mpatamanga
properties.FaultNotes: Offsets prominent dyke, but no evidence of recent offset.

properties.Name: Tedzani Falls-1
properties.FaultNotes: Offsets prominent dyke,  but no evidence of recent offset.

properties.Name: Tedzani Falls-2
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag,  possibly associated with knickpoint on the Shire River.

properties.Name: Matope Bridge
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Bounds a region of high relief to W,  but surface expression has no evience of recent activity.

properties.Name: Little Michiru Ridge
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Fault to west of perthosite intrusion that cores regional north plunging synform.

properties.Name: Nkhunvu
properties.FaultNotes: Small (300 m) dextral offset evident in aeromag data. Unlikely to be reactivated in current normal fault stress state.

properties.Name: Chingale Ring-3
properties.FaultNotes: Small (300 m) dextral offset evident in aeromag data.  Unlikely to be reactivated in current normal fault stress state.

properties.Name: Chingale Ring-4
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Forms gully with no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Chingale Ring-1
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Forms gully with no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Chingale Ring-2
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  Forms gully with no evidence of recent activity.

properties.Name: Mongolowe-3
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.

properties.Name: Mongolowe-4
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.

properties.Name: Mongolowe-2
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.

properties.Name: Mongolowe-1
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.

properties.Name: Namkokwe
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.

properties.Name: Nkhonde
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  E-W strike,  unlikely to be active in current stress state.

properties.Name: Nasenga
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  E-W strike,  unlikely to be active in current stress state.

properties.Name: Njera Hill
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  E-W strike,  unlikely to be active in current stress state.

properties.Name: Lake Malombe
properties.FaultNotes: Mapped from aeromag.  ESE-WNW strike,  unlikely to be active in current stress state

properties.Name: Wamkurumadzi Tip-1
properties.FaultNotes: May act as structure to help link Wamkurumadzi and Thyolo,  but very low confidence for this profound assertion.

properties.Name: Lake Malawi Eastern Arm-1
properties.FaultNotes: Laterall offets indicate dextral strike-slip activity.  If vertically dipping,  poorly oriented for reactivation.

properties.Name: Lake Malawi Eastern Arm-2
properties.FaultNotes: Laterall offets indicate dextral strike-slip activity.  If vertically dipping,  poorly oriented for reactivation.

properties.Name: Lake Malawi Eastern Arm-3
properties.FaultNotes: Laterall offets indicate dextral strike-slip activity.  If vertically dipping,  poorly oriented for reactivation.

properties.Name: Lake Malawi Eastern Arm-5
properties.FaultNotes: Laterall offets indicate dextral strike-slip activity.  If vertically dipping,  poorly oriented for reactivation.

properties.Name: Lake Malawi Eastern Arm-4
properties.FaultNotes: Laterall offets indicate dextral strike-slip activity.  If vertically dipping,  poorly oriented for reactivation.

properties.Name: Lake Malawi Eastern Arm-6
properties.FaultNotes: Laterall offets indicate dextral strike-slip activity.  If vertically dipping,  poorly oriented for reactivation.

properties.Name: Mwembeshi
properties.FaultNotes: Surface trace of major Pan-African shear zone
properties.Reference: Peters (1975), Ring et al (2002), Lao-Davila et al (2015)

properties.Name: Damba
properties.FaultNotes: Surface trace of major Pan-African shear zone.

properties.Name: Lwafwa Forest
properties.FaultNotes: Forms minor (~200 m high) escarpment.

properties.Name: Luwazi
properties.FaultNotes: Forms ~400 m high escarpment,  but no EAR sediment accumulation in hanging-wall.

properties.Name: Mzuzu
properties.FaultNotes: Forms minor (~100 m) high escarpment

properties.Name: Zulunkhuni River
properties.FaultNotes: Forms minor (~100 m) high escarpment.

properties.Name: Pangi Point-3
properties.FaultNotes: Forms valley that cross-cuts foliation.

properties.Name: Pangi Point-2
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of ENE-WSW foliation parallel faults.

properties.Name: Pangi Point-1
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of ENE-WSW foliation parallel faults.

properties.Name: North Rukuru-3
properties.FaultNotes: One of a set of ENE-WSW foliation parallel faults.

properties.Name: Songwe-2
properties.FaultNotes: Smaller (~100 m) escarpment than along strike to the south.  Karoo bounding fault? Fault segmented.

properties.Name: Songwe-1
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes amphibolite gneiss against biotte gneisses.

properties.Name: Kyungu River-1
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes amphibolite gneiss against biotte gneisses.

properties.Name: Kaseye River
properties.FaultNotes: Juxtaposes amphibolite gneiss against biotte gneisses.

properties.Name: Kyungu River-2
properties.FaultNotes: Bounds small sliver Karoo sediments to its north.

properties.Name: Chilingi
properties.FaultNotes: Offsets geological contacts and aeromagnetic fabrics.

properties.Name: Runyina
properties.FaultNotes: Forms incised valley.  Fault marked as normal,  but also sinistral offset of geolgical contacts.

properties.Name: Katundu
properties.FaultNotes: Interpreted as poorly oriented for reactivation.
